In preparation for the upcoming football season, there are a few things to know as a spectator.
1) With social distancing guidelines in effect, there will only be 400 seats available in the bleachers on the home side. Spectators will be able to use every other row for seating and must sit at least six feet away from the next spectator that is not a family member.
2) There will be standing room available on either side of the bleachers, but we must continue to follow social distancing guidelines in these areas also.
3) Spectators can bring a lawn chair and sit in the grass area north of the football field. The same social distancing guidelines apply to this area as well. Lawn chairs will be okay, but tents and canopies will not be allowed so that the vision of other spectators is not blocked.
4) All those in attendance will have to have a voucher in order to purchase a ticket.
5) All those in attendance will have to wear a face covering.

Thank you

The Little Rock FBI office issued a general awareness statement about information they received relating to a possible school shooting in Arkansas on August 29. The FBI could not confirm the identity of the reporting party but knows they live in another country and allegedly received this information in an online gaming platform.

Salem School District is NOT aware of any threat specific to our school district.

Although the threat does not name any specific Arkansas school, we do take all law enforcement announcements seriously. At Salem School District, our students' and employees' safety is a top priority. We already have a school resource officer on campus and we will have an increased police presence on this day. We will continue to communicate and coordinate with local law enforcement in the coming days and take appropriate security measures.
